quest_timeline.event: King of Uruk, two-thirds god, one-third man
Enkidu created as equal, becomes friend
Defeats Humbaba, guardian of Cedar Forest
Slays the Bull of Heaven with Enkidu
Enkidu dies as punishment from gods
Fails test to stay awake seven days
Accepts mortality, finds meaning in legacy

accomplishments.title: Building Uruk
accomplishments.description: Created the great walled city

accomplishments.title: Defeating Humbaba
accomplishments.description: Slew the terrifying forest guardian

accomplishments.title: Bull of Heaven
accomplishments.description: Killed the divine bull sent by Ishtar

accomplishments.title: Journey Beyond Death
accomplishments.description: Crossed the Waters of Death and returned

accomplishments.title: Wisdom Through Suffering
accomplishments.description: Learned to accept mortality and value life

trials.name: Death of Enkidu
trials.description: Lost his only true friend and equal

trials.name: Failed Immortality
trials.description: Could not stay awake, lost plant to serpent

trials.name: Rejection by Ishtar
trials.description: Angered goddess brought divine wrath

trials.name: Acceptance of Mortality
trials.description: Ultimate challenge of being partly mortal

data.description: The spiritual leader of Tibetan Buddhism, believed to be the reincarnation of Avalokiteshvara, the Bodhisattva of Compassion. The current (14th) Dalai Lama, Tenzin Gyatso, is a Nobel Peace Prize laureate and global spiritual leader.
data.name: Buddhist Mythology

data.description: Tibetan king (7th century CE) who introduced Buddhism to Tibet. Considered an emanation of Avalokiteshvara. Built the first Buddhist temples in Tibet including the Jokhang.
data.name: Buddhist Mythology

data.description: The Second Buddha, Founder of Madhyamaka Philosophy
data.name: Founder of Madhyamaka

data.description: 8th century Indian Buddhist monk and scholar, author of the Bodhicharyavatara (Guide to the Bodhisattva's Way of Life), one of the most important texts on compassion and the bodhisattva path.
data.name: Buddhist Mythology

data.description: Great Tibetan Buddhist teacher (1357-1419) and founder of the Gelug school of Tibetan Buddhism. Considered an emanation of Manjushri, the Bodhisattva of Wisdom.
data.name: Buddhist Mythology

data.description: Brother of Peter, first disciple to follow Jesus, evangelist who brought others to Christ. Martyred on an X-shaped cross that bears his name.
data.name: The First Called

data.displayName: ‚öîÔ∏è James the Greater - Son of Thunder
data.description: Son of Zebedee, brother of John, member of Christ's inner circle. The first apostle martyred, beheaded by Herod Agrippa in 44 CE.
data.name: Son of Thunder

quest_timeline.event: Born to Hebrew slaves in Egypt
Set adrift in basket, found by Pharaohs daughter
Burning Bush, commanded to free Israel
Aaron given as spokesman, staff as sign
Returns to Egypt to confront Pharaoh
Strikes rock instead of speaking to it
Views Promised Land from Mount Nebo

son: later a brutal warrior at Troy
father: King of the Myrmidons in Phthia

quest_timeline.event: Born to Peleus and sea nymph Thetis
Dipped in River Styx, made invulnerable
Prophecy: glory at Troy or long life at home
Odysseus discovers him, sails for Troy
Quarrel with Agamemnon, withdraws from battle
Patroclus killed by Hector wearing his armor
Returns to battle in divine rage
Killed by Paris arrow to heel

accomplishments.title: Greatest Warrior of Troy
accomplishments.description: Undefeated champion of the Achaeans

quests: Psyche (Soul): Represents the human soul's journey toward divine love
Eros (Love): Divine love that transforms and elevates
The Trials: The soul's purification through suffering and perseverance
Looking at Eros: The danger of curiosity and lack of faith
Apotheosis: The soul achieving immortality through love
data.name: Eros and Psyche
Heracles
attributes: Alcides (birth name), Hercules (Roman), Lion of Nemea, Champion of Olympus, Defender of Mankind
Strength, heroism, labors, perseverance, athletic prowess, protection, courage
Lion skin, club, bow and arrows, olive wreath, golden apples
Great club (of olive wood), bow and hydra-poisoned arrows, sword
Golden tan (lion skin), olive green, crimson

quest_timeline.event: Born to Alcmene and Zeus in Thebes
Madness from Hera kills wife and children
Oracle of Delphi commands servitude to Eurystheus
Completes all Labors, freed from servitude
Dies from poisoned robe, ascends to Olympus

data.description: Leader of the Argonauts and Seeker of the Golden Fleece

sons: Mermeros and Pheres (or Thessalus and Alcimenes)
killed by Medea; twin sons by Hypsipyle of Lemnos
father: rightful king of Iolcus (killed or driven to suicide by Pelias)
uncle: usurper of Iolcus (killed by his own daughters through Medea's trickery)
enemies: and ultimately Medea herself after his betrayal
allies: various helpers encountered during the voyage

data.name: Jason

quest_timeline.event: Born prince of Iolcus, hidden by mother
Pelias promises throne for Golden Fleece
Launches Argo, ship with fifty oars
Games at Lemnos, island of women
Arrives in Colchis, meets King Aeetes
Medea falls in love via Aphrodite/Hera
Medea helps steal the Golden Fleece
Medea kills Pelias, Jason rules briefly

father: in most traditions) or Oeagrus (King of Thrace)
dionysus: (in some versions) Who incited the Maenads against him

data.name: Greek Mythology
attributes: Son of Apollo/Oeagrus and Calliope, Prophet of the Mysteries, Prince of Thrace, The Enchanter
Music, poetry, prophecy, mysteries, healing through song, eloquence
Lyre (seven-stringed), laurel wreath, tortoise (lyre's shell origin)
All creatures were subject to his music‚Äîlions, serpents, birds, even the beasts of the wild
Thrace, Lesbos (where his head washed ashore), various Orphic temples

even the beasts of the wild

Music stops tortures of the damned

zeus: ensured his survival through divine providence
medusa: The mortal Gorgon whose death brought forth Pegasus
athena: provided the polished shield and guided his sword-stroke
grandfather: King of Argos (accidentally killed by Perseus
hermes: Gave the harpe and winged sandals
dictys: The humble fisherman who became his foster-father
pegasus: The winged horse born from Medusa's blood (later tamed by Bellerophon)

data.name: Perseus
attributes: Gorgon-Slayer, Founder of Mycenae, Son of the Golden Rain, Rescuer of Andromeda
Heroism, monster-slaying, divine favor, kingship, cunning
Medusa's head (Gorgoneion), winged sandals, helm of invisibility, kibisis (magic bag)
Harpe (curved adamantine sword from Hermes), polished bronze shield (from Athena)
Winged sandals (flight), Cap of Hades (invisibility), kibisis (safely contain Medusa's head)
Ancestor of Heracles, founder of the Perseid dynasty, constellation bearer

quest_timeline.event: Born to Danae and Zeus in bronze chamber

data.description: Eighth avatar of Vishnu, teacher of the Bhagavad Gita, and one of Hinduism's most beloved deities. See also Krishna as Deity.
data.name: Krishna

quest_timeline.event: Born in prison to Devaki and Vasudeva
Smuggled to Vrindavan to escape Kamsa
Lifts Mount Govardhan to protect villagers
Defeats serpent Kaliya in Yamuna river

Becomes charioteer and guide to Arjuna
Guides Pandavas to victory in great war

data.name: Eyes of Azrael

data.description:
Abraham (Hebrew: Avraham) is the founding patriarch of the Jewish people, the first Hebrew, and the father of
monotheism. Born Abram in Ur of the Chaldees, he received God's call to leave his homeland and journey to Canaan, where
God established an eternal covenant with him and his descendants. He is revered as "Avraham Avinu" (Abraham our Father),
the first to recognize the One True God and the ancestor of the Israelite nation.
data.name: Avraham Avinu | Jewish Heroes

data.description: Egyptian Ritual Purity vs. Israelite Covenant Sign: The Flint Knife Connection
data.name: Circumcision Parallels: Egyptian Ritual Purity and Israelite Covenant | Eyes of Azrael

data.description: Egyptian Monotheism, Moses, and the Question of Aten's Influence on Israelite Religion
data.name: Akhenaten and Yahwism: Egyptian Monotheism and Moses | Eyes of Azrael

data.displayName: Enoch as Idris in Islamic Tradition
data.name: Eyes of Azrael

data.description: Moses and Aaron vs. Pharaoh's Sorcerers: Divine Power vs. Egyptian Magic
data.name: The Magician Showdown: Moses vs. Pharaoh's Sorcerers | Eyes of Azrael

data.description:
Moses (Moshe in Hebrew) is the greatest prophet in Jewish tradition, the lawgiver who received the Torah at
Mount Sinai and led the Israelites from slavery in Egypt to freedom. He is revered as "Moshe Rabbeinu" (Moses our
Teacher), the mediator between God and Israel, and the founder of the Jewish nation and religion.
data.name: Moshe Rabbeinu | Jewish Heroes

accomplishments.title: Wisdom Through Suffering
accomplishments.description: Learned to accept mortality and value life

trials.name: Acceptance of Mortality
trials.description: Ultimate challenge of being partly mortal
